docs.lead_paragraph: If your crucial joints are still intact, or just beginning to creak, here are some ways to keep osteoarthritis — and the cost of hip or knee replacement — at bay.

headline.seo: Caring for Hips and Knees to Avoid Artificial Joints
headline.main: Caring for Hips and Knees to Avoid Artificial Joints
headline.print_headline: Save a Knee or Hip, Save Money (and Avoid Pain)

docs.snippet: If your crucial joints are still intact, or just beginning to creak, here are some ways to keep osteoarthritis — and the cost of hip or knee replacement — at bay.

docs.lead_paragraph: Everyone's having fun with the chickens for checkups story, in which Sue Lowden, the leading Republican Senate candidate in Nevada, expressed a desire to return to the good old days in which people who wanted a checkup from their doctor would offer a chicken in exchange. And she's not backing down!
docs.abstract: Ms. Lowden's perspective is ludicrous even without the feathers.
docs.snippet: Ms. Lowden's perspective is ludicrous even without the feathers.

docs.lead_paragraph: A variety of consumer-focused articles appear daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.

headline.main: Friday Reading: Indulging the Urge to Divulge

docs.abstract: Help with the the buy or rent decision, free hot spots for some cable customers and other consumer-focused items from Friday's Times.
docs.snippet: Help with the the buy or rent decision, free hot spots for some cable customers and other consumer-focused items from Friday's Times.

docs.lead_paragraph: Tucked into the huge new health care law is a whopping $777 million, spread over the next four years, for programs to prevent and prosecute elder abuse. Advocates for these programs have been begging Congress for more money since 1978. Now they are celebrating as if they had won the lottery.

headline.main: In the Health Bill, a New Focus on Elder Abuse

docs.abstract: Tucked into the new health care law is $777 million for the prevention of abuse to the elderly.
docs.snippet: Tucked into the new health care law is $777 million for the prevention of abuse to the elderly.

headline.main: Are Insurance Companies Still Exempt From Antitrust Laws?

docs.abstract: The health law did not overturn the insurance industry's exemption from antitrust law, but a separate bill passed by the House may yet do so.
docs.snippet: The health law did not overturn the insurance industry's exemption from antitrust law, but a separate bill passed by the House may yet do so.

docs.lead_paragraph: Voters will decide this fall whether to ban health insurance mandates, including those required by the federal health care overhaul.

headline.main: Florida: Health Overhaul on November Ballot
headline.print_headline: Florida: Health Overhaul On November Ballot

docs.snippet: Voters will decide this fall whether to ban health insurance mandates, including those required by the federal health care overhaul.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration wants to add $408 million to a global fund to encourage good farming practices in the developing world.

headline.main: Millions Sought for Global Fund to Aid Farms
headline.print_headline: U.S. May Add to Global Food Fund

docs.snippet: The Obama administration wants to add $408 million to a global fund to encourage good farming practices in the developing world.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama got something of a laugh during his address today on Wall Street when he read a passage from Time magazine about the "wild-eyed alarm'' running through "the great banking houses of Manhattan'' over a Congressional measure designed to protect consumers.
docs.abstract: President Obama reaches back to 1933 to show how unpopular it is to impose consumer protections on the financial industry.
docs.snippet: President Obama reaches back to 1933 to show how unpopular it is to impose consumer protections on the financial industry.

docs.lead_paragraph: Following is the second set of responses from Dr. Laura Erickson-Schroth, who is working on "Trans Bodies, Trans Selves," a resource guide for transgender and other gender-variant people, covering health, legal issues, cultural and social questions, history and theory.
docs.abstract: Taking Questions: Dr. Laura Erickson-Schroth, who is working on a resource guide for transgender and other gender-variant people, responds to readers.
docs.snippet: Taking Questions: Dr. Laura Erickson-Schroth, who is working on a resource guide for transgender and other gender-variant people, responds to readers.

docs.lead_paragraph: Stephanie Cutter, the Democratic communications strategist who spearheaded the White House effort last year to win Senate confirmation of Justice Sonia Sotomayor to the Supreme Court, is returning to the Obama administration to help sell the newly passed health care bill.

headline.main: White House Chooses Cutter to Pitch Health Care

docs.abstract: Stephanie Cutter, a longtime Democratic consultant, joins the White House to help with communications on the new law.
docs.snippet: Stephanie Cutter, a longtime Democratic consultant, joins the White House to help with communications on the new law.
